ther

too.

oups.com, "--- M." <patriot014@...> wrote:
>
> Yamakawa Hiroshi, the former=
 Aizu retainer who was a close friend 
of Saitou 
> Hajime (Fujita Gorou), =
wrote a poem on the occasion of Goro's son 
Tsutomu's 
> birth. I can't qui=
te make out the meaning-- it plays off his name 
> "tsutomu"-- which means =
"to work [hard]," and exhorts him to grow 
into a 
> distinguished man, but=
 I wanted to share it in transliterated form.
> 
> Tsutometefu
> Na ni somu=
kasu wa
> yakate yoni
> takaku tsutomu no
> tatasareme ya wa
>

on http://o.z-z.jp/b/zaneika/log/20.html
>
